required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DSA Risk Factors in MMF-based Immunosuppressed Post-transplanted Patients
clinical_study.official_title: DSA Risk Factors in Chinese Kidney Transplant Patients Using MPA-based Immunosuppression Protocol: A Multi-center Clinical Study

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

brief_summary.textblock: Kidney transplantation is the best therapy method for patients with uremia. The main factors affecting the long-term survival of the graft were chronic antibody-mediated rejection and the death of the patients. Newborn donor special antibody (DSA) is a major risk factor for chronic antibody-mediated rejection (AMR) and poor transplantation outcomes. Detection of mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) trough concentration can help estimate its exposure. Deficient exposure of MMF can lead to AMR after transplantation surgery. The aim of this study is to estimate the risk factors of one-year DSA after transplantation.

primary_outcome.description: newborn DSA in recipient serum in the first 12 month after transplantation

secondary_outcome.description: newborn DSA in recipient serum in the first 6 month after transplantation
trough concentration of MMF in recipients' serum
serum creatinine and creatinine clearance in 1 year after transplantation

arm_group.description: Post-transplant patients accept immunosuppression protocol based on MMF for at least 12 months.

biospec_descr.textblock: blood sample to dectect MMF trough concentration

study_pop.textblock: Recipients after kidney transplantation using triple immunosuppression protocol based on MMF

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- years 18-65
- single organ transplantation
- first time to accept kidney transplantation
- Triple immunosuppression protocol based on MMF, tacrolimus and glucocorticoid
- PRA negative before transplantation
- not pregnant for female
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not accept MMF
- multi-organ transplantation
- pregnancy or lactation period female
- mental illness
- past tumor, peptic ulcer, severe cardiopulmonary disease, active liver disease history
- Cannot regular follow up
